intro: Satureja subisodonta, commonly known as narrow-leaved savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and have a pungent, peppery aroma, often used in culinary and medicinal applications. Satureja subisodonta is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
